docs.name: ScorecardComponent
docs.comment:
Standalone scorecard component.

This component is meant to be reused/embedded in larger components.

ng-content:

  • name -- Custom content in the label area.
  • value -- Custom content in the value area.
  • description -- Custom content in the description area. For this to show up, requires also setting the description attribute, even if it's only set to the empty string.

inputs.name: changeGlyph
inputs.comment: Whether to display a small change arrow glyph in the description; optional.

inputs.name: changeType
inputs.comment:
Set the type of change depicted by scorecard.

This determines the style of the description. Possible values are:

  • 'POSITIVE'
  • 'NEGATIVE'
  • 'NEUTRAL' (default)

inputs.name: extraBig
inputs.comment: Whether to use the "big" class style for scorecards; optional.

inputs.name: selectable
inputs.comment: Whether the selection state of the scorecard can be changed by clicking.

inputs.name: selectedColor
inputs.comment: The Color to apply to the scorecard background when it is selected.

inputs.name: suggestionAfter
inputs.comment: A piece of suggestion text after the description; optional.

inputs.name: suggestionBefore
inputs.comment: A piece of suggestion text before the description; optional.

inputs.name: tooltip
inputs.comment: The value displayed in a tooltip when the users hovers over the value.

docs.name: ScoreboardComponent
docs.comment:
This component manages a row of scorecards.

a11y note: The default selectable colors use the charting palette from palette.dart which has some colors which do not obey color contrast it is adviseable that you specify your selected colors instead of relying on the default.

Attributes:

  • enableUniformWidths: bool -- Whether scorecards in the scoreboard should have uniform widths.

inputs.name: isVertical
inputs.comment: Whether the scorecard is displayed vertically. Defaults to false.

inputs.name: resetOnCardChanges
inputs.comment:
Whether to reset the card selection when there are card changes.

If a card is added or removed, and this is set to true, then all cards will be deselected. For ScoreboardType.radio, the first card will be selected.

inputs.name: scrollable
inputs.comment:
Whether allow scrolling the scoreboard via scroll buttons.

Scrollable property can be set dynamically during app runtime -- will add or remove window resize listener depending on state of scrollable.

inputs.name: type
inputs.comment: Type of scoreboard, e.g., standard, selectable, radio, toggle.
